    • Content

      /* TESSWelfareCalculation.do */
/** @author Allcott and Taubinsky
* "The Lightbulb Paradox"

* This file calculates the welfare gains from debiasing, 
* under the assumption that within-subject changes in the 
* treatment group are entirely from debiasing.

* It is intended to reflect the welfare gains from costless and powerful information provision, to be compared to the subsidy or ban.

* This assumes market price = 0
*/
/*  */
use Calculations/PreppedTESSData.dta,clear
drop if WTP1==.|WTP2==.
gen PurchaseCFL1 = cond(WTP1>0,1,0)
gen PurchaseCFL2 = cond(WTP2>0,1,0)
gen ChangedDecision = cond(PurchaseCFL1!=PurchaseCFL2,1,0)

gen absWTP2 = abs(WTP2)
gen absWTP2_WTP1 = abs(WTP2_WTP1)

** Apparent welfare gains in treatment
sum absWTP2 if T==1&ChangedDecision==1 [aw=Weight]
sum absWTP2 if T==1 [aw=Weight]

display 165.7437/773.907899
display 165.7437/773.907899* 3.362292



** Analogous calculation for control group
sum absWTP2 if T==0&ChangedDecision==1 [aw=Weight]
sum absWTP2 if T==0 [aw=Weight]

display 77.2015004/421.7804
display 77.2015004/421.7804 * 1.04003


** This is for an (unused) formula that Dmitry suggested:
*sum absWTP2_WTP1 if T==0&ChangedDecision==1 [aw=Weight]
*display 77.2015004/421.7804 * 1.402525
*display 77.2015004/421.7804 * 2.252016
